sense.gloss: to drop, to lose, to let fall, to shed (light), to cast (one's gaze), to pour in (liquid), to leave behind
to clean off (dirt, makeup, paint, etc.), to remove (e.g. stains or facial hair), to lose, to spend money at a certain place, to omit, to leave out, to secretly let escape
to lose (a match), to reject (an applicant), to fail (a course), to defeat (in an election)

to lower (e.g. shoulders or voice), to lessen (e.g. production or body weight), to worsen (quality), to reduce (e.g. rank or popularity), to speak badly of, to make light of, to fall into straitened circumstances

to fall into (e.g. a dilemma or sin), to make one's own, to have one's bid accepted, to force surrender, to take (e.g. an enemy camp or castle), to forcefully convince, to press for a confession, to deal with
to download, to copy from a computer to another medium
to make someone swoon (judo)
to finish a story (e.g. with the punch line)
to finish (a period, e.g. of fasting)
to win over, to seduce, to conquer (unwillingness)
depravity, corruption, degradation
abortion, feticide
self-indulgent, undisciplined, slovenly, debauched, negligent
Vajrasattva, Supreme Being of tantric Buddhism
the Fall of Man, the Fall
to degenerate, to lapse into
abortionist
apostate priest
inertia, momentum
force of habit

sdata.j: ↑意思↑↓いし↓の↑強↑↓つよ↓い↑人↑↓ひと↓は↑堕落↑↓だらく↓しない。
sdata.e: A man of strong will is not subject to corruption.

sdata.j: たいてい↑本当↑↓ほんとう↓に↑堕落↑↓だらく↓した↑感↑↓かん↓じだね。
sdata.e: Most people here have really hit the skids.

sdata.j: ↑妻↑↓つま↓が↑堕落↑↓だらく↓するのは↑夫↑↓おっと↓が↑悪↑↓わる↓いのだ。
sdata.e: It is their husbands' faults if wives do fall.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑市政↑↓しせい↓の↑堕落↑↓だらく↓を↑暴露↑↓ばくろ↓した。
sdata.e: He exposed corruption in the city government.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓が↑出会↑↓であ↓った↑堕落↑↓だらく↓した↑人↑↓ひと↓たちの↑中↑↓なか↓でもっともひどい↑人↑↓ひと↓の↑１↑↓ひと↓↑人↑↓り↓だ。
sdata.e: He is one of the rottenest fellows that have ever crossed my path.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑道徳的↑↓どうとくてき↓に↑堕落↑↓だらく↓した。
↑麻薬↑↓まやく↓↑中毒↑↓ちゅうどく↓で↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑人↑↓ひと↓が↑堕落↑↓だらく↓した。

words.gloss: to drop, to lose, to let fall, to shed (light), to cast (one's gaze), to pour in (liquid), to leave behind
